message.content: {"responses": [{"question_id": "TT4G35A", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers write or improve lesson plans.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35B", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35C", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence assists teachers in supporting students individually.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35D", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence supports students with specific needs (e.g. multilingual learners, students with special education needs).", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35E", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence helps teachers automate administrative tasks.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35F", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own.", "response": "Strongly agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35G", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35H", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35I", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence jeopardises the privacy and security of student data.", "response": "Agree"}, {"question_id": "TT4G35J", "input_statement": "Artificial intelligence suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches that teachers would use with students.", "response": "Agree"}]}
message.reasoning_content:
I need to respond to this survey as a primary or secondary school teacher from Belgium. The statements cover both positive aspects of AI in education (A-E) and potential concerns/risks (F-J).

Let me think about appropriate responses from a teacher's perspective:

[TT4G35A]: AI helps teachers write or improve lesson plans - This is realistic, AI tools like ChatGPT can help generate ideas and content. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35B]: AI enables teachers to adapt learning material to different students' abilities - This is possible with AI personalization, though it requires proper setup. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35C]: AI assists teachers in supporting students individually - AI can provide some support through tutoring systems. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35D]: AI supports students with specific needs - AI can help with translations, text-to-speech, etc. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35E]: AI helps teachers automate administrative tasks - This is quite true, grading tools, scheduling, etc. I'd say "Strongly agree"

[TT4G35F]: AI enables students to misrepresent others' work as their own - This is a real concern with AI tools. I'd say "Strongly agree" (this is a concern statement)

[TT4G35G]: AI makes recommendations that may not be appropriate or correct - AI can make mistakes. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35H]: AI amplifies biases that reinforce students' misconceptions - This is a known risk. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35I]: AI jeopardises the privacy and security of student data - This is a legitimate concern. I'd say "Agree"

[TT4G35J]: AI suggests unsuitable pedagogical approaches - Possible but depends on the AI tool. I'd say "Agree"

I should provide a balanced perspective as a teacher - positive about legitimate uses but also aware of risks and concerns.
